item.title: EHS Shares Safety Tips for Fire Prevention Week
item.description: The National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 2025 Fire Prevention Week theme is “Charge into Fire Safety: Lithium-Ion Batteries in Your Home.” In support of this year’s campaign, EHS has gathered key safety tips on reducing fire hazards connected to everyday rechargeable devices and battery-powered equipment.

item.title: “Good Enough Art” Talk On October 9
item.description: Amid a historic decline of the middle class caused in part by the “missing middle” housing crisis, Anna Kornbluh (Professor of English, University of Illinois - Chicago) argues that cultural study must revamp its traditional sociological methods. Briefly considering architecture, photography, fiction, and television, this talk experiments with a formalist approach to mid aesthetics: “good enough art.” Join us Oct. 9 at 6:30pm in Sage 3303.

item.title: Mainstreaming Mental Well-being: A Training Series for Faculty and Staff | Oct. 14 (Please register)
item.description: The Mainstreaming Mental Wellbeing (MMWB) Taskforce envisions an RPI community in which mental health and well-being are central tenets, both in and out of the classroom. This training series will give you concrete knowledge, skills, and resources to play an active role in supporting student wellbeing at RPI. item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff In Person Workshop - Deeper Dive into the Active Learning Approaches of Jigsaw, Think/Pair/Share, & Visual Maps | Oct. 14
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, October 14, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - In this workshop, we will focus on the three active learning concepts of the Jigsaw activity, Think/Pair/Share and working with Visual Maps/Charts. We will spend some time on each of these three approaches, discussing the concept of each and looking at examples to help you think about how you might be able to incorporate the approach into your class as an activity. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
